description: The Corrupted LSP Detected Notification is generated when
a corrupted Link State PDU is detected in memory.
The Corrupted LSP Received Notification is generated when
a corrupted Link State PDU is Received. The occurance of
this event is counted by the isisSysCorrLSPscounter.
The ID of the LSP that was found to be Corrupted.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapCorruptedLSPID

description: Number of corrupted LSPs detected.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysCorrLSPs

description: The LSP L1 Database Overload Notification is generated when the
l1State of the system changes between On and Waiting or Waiting
and On. The isisSysL1State argument is set to indicate the
resulting state, and in the case of Waiting the isisSysID is
set to indicate the source of the LSP which precipitated the
overload. The occurance of this event is counted by the
isisSysLSPL1DbaseOloads counter.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisLSPL1DatabaseOverload ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL1State i 1 ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL1DbaseOloads c 9999

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisLSPL1DatabaseOverload ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL1State i 2 ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL1DbaseOloads c 9999

description: The state of the Level 1 database.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL1State

description: The ID for this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This value is appended to each of the
instance's area addresses to form the Network Entity
Titles valid for this instance. The derivation of a value
for this object is implementation-specific. Some
implementations may assign values and not permit write
MAX-ACCESS, others may require the value to be set manually.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID

description: Number of times the LSP L1 database has become
overloaded.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL1DbaseOloads

description: The LSP L2 Database Overload Notification is generated when the
l2State of the system changes between On and Waiting or Waiting and
On. The isisSysL2State argument is set to indicate the
resulting state, and in the case of Waiting the isisSysID is set to
indicate the source of the LSP which precipitated the overload.
The occurance of this event is counted by the
isisSysLSPL2DbaseOloads counter.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisLSPL2DatabaseOverload ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL2State i 1 ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL2DbaseOloads c 9999

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisLSPL2DatabaseOverload ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL2State i 2 ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL2DbaseOloads c 9999

description: The state of the Level 2 database.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysL2State

description: The ID for this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This value is appended to each of the
instance's area addresses to form the Network Entity
Titles valid for this instance. The derivation of a value
for this object is implementation-specific. Some
implementations may assign values and not permit write
MAX-ACCESS, others may require the value to be set manually.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID

description: Number of times the Level 2 LSP database has become
overloaded.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysLSPL2DbaseOloads

description: Generated when a PDU is received with an incorrect
Authentication information field
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisAuthenticationFailure ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSysID s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapAuthErrorType i 9999 HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapAuthErrorInfo s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysAuthFails c 9999

description: The system ID and circuit ID of the neighboring
Intermediate System set from the source ID field
of the neighbor's IIH PDUs.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSysID

description: The type of Authentication Error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapAuthErrorType

description: The Information Pertaining to the Authentication error.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapAuthErrorInfo

description: The number of authentication failures recognized by this
instance of the protocol.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysAuthFails

description: Generated when a Adjacency Request for Wrong/unsupported
adjacency type is made.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisWrongSysType ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysType i 1 HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdSysType i 9999 HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisSysWrongSysTypes c 9999

description: The ID for this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This value is appended to each of the
instance's area addresses to form the Network Entity
Titles valid for this instance. The derivation of a value
for this object is implementation-specific. Some
implementations may assign values and not permit write
MAX-ACCESS, others may require the value to be set manually.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID

description: The type of this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This object follows the
replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behaviour.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysType

description: The Received system Type.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdSysType

description: Number of Times Wrong System Types requested for Adjacencies.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisSysWrongSysTypes

description: Generated when a PDU of Wrong/different version is received
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisVersionSkew ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircVersionSkews c 9999

description: The version number of the IS-IS protocol to which this
instance conforms. This value must be set by the
implementation when the row is valid.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysVersion

description: The version number of the IS-IS protocol that was received.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdVersion

description: The number of PDUs of different version was received
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircVersionSkews

description: The hwIsisIDFieldLengthMismatch Notification is generated when a PDU is
received with a different value for ID field length to that of the
receiving Intermediate system. The occurance of this
event is counted by the isisSysIDFieldLenMismatches.
The Length of the SystemID of current system.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapSysIDLength

description: The Receined systemID Length
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdSysIDLength

description: Number of times a PDU is received with a different value
for ID field length to that of the receiving system.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysIDFieldLenMismatches

description: Generated when a PDU is received from Wrong/different
area not recognised by this system
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisAreaMismatch ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdAreaAddr s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircAreaMismatches c 9999

description: The ID for this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This value is appended to each of the
instance's area addresses to form the Network Entity
Titles valid for this instance. The derivation of a value
for this object is implementation-specific. Some
implementations may assign values and not permit write
MAX-ACCESS, others may require the value to be set manually.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID

description: The Received Area Address
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdAreaAddr

description: The number PDUs from an unrecognised area was received
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircAreaMismatches

description: Generated when a PDU is received from Wrong/different
area not recognised by this system
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisMaxAreaAddrMismatch ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID s EXAMPLE ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysMaxAreaAddresses i 0 HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdMaxAreaAddr i 9999 ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysMaxAreaAddrMismatches c 9999

description: The ID for this instance of the Integrated IS-IS
protocol. This value is appended to each of the
instance's area addresses to form the Network Entity
Titles valid for this instance. The derivation of a value
for this object is implementation-specific. Some
implementations may assign values and not permit write
MAX-ACCESS, others may require the value to be set manually.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysID

description: The maximum number of area addresses to be permitted for
the area in which this instance exists. Note that all
Intermediate Systems in the same area must have the same
value configured for this attribute if correct operation
is to be assumed. This object follows the
replaceOnlyWhileDisabled behaviour.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysMaxAreaAddresses

description: The Max Area Address Count in a received PDU.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapRecdMaxAreaAddr

description: Number of times a PDU is received with a different value
for MaximumAreaAddresses from that of the receiving
system.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysMaxAreaAddrMismatches

description: The Manual Address Dropped From Area Notification is generated
when one of the manualAreaAddresses (specified on this system) is
ignored when computing partitionAreaAddresses or areaAddresses
because there are more than MaximumAreaAddresses distinct
Area Addresses. The hwIsisTrapDroppedAreaAddr argument
is set to the ignored Area Address. It is generated once for
each Area Address in manualAreaAddresses which is dropped.
The occurance of this event is counted by the
isisSysManAddrDropFromAreas counter.

event.Summary: IS-IS manual address dropped from area ($v1)

description: The Area Address that was dropped by
the system when the count of area
addresses exceeded the Maximum .
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisTrapDroppedAreaAddr

description: Number of times a manual address has been dropped from
the area.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysManAddrDropFromAreas

description: The Attempt To Exceed Maximum Sequence Number Notification is
generated when an attempt is made to increment the sequence
number of an LSP beyond the maximum sequence number.
Following the generation of this event the operation of the
Routeing state machine shall be disabled for atleast
(MaxAge + ZeroAgeLifetime) seconds. The occurance of this
event is counted by the isisSysAttmptToExMaxSeqNums
counter.
Number of times the IS has attempted to exceed the
maximum sequence number.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysAttmptToExMaxSeqNums

description: The Sequence Number Skipped Notification is generated when the
sequence number of an LSP is incremented by more than one. The
occurance of this event is counted by the isisSysSeqNumSkips
counter.

event.Summary: Sequence number of LSP incremented by more than one

description: Number of times a sequence number skip has occurred.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysSeqNumSkips

description: The Own LSP Purged Notification is generated when a zero aged copy
of a system's own LSP is received from some other system. This
represents an erroneous attempt to purge the local system's LSP.
The occurance of this event is counted by the isisSysOwnLSPPurges
counter.

event.Summary: Received zero-aged copy of own LSP from another system

description: Number of times a zero-aged copy of the system's own LSP
is received from some other node.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisSysOwnLSPPurges

description: The Circuit Change Notification is generated when the state of
the Circuit changes from On to Off or from Off to On. The relative
order of events relating to the same Circuit must be preserved.
The functional state of the circuit. This specifies
whether the circuit is currently active or not.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircFuncState

description: The number of times the circuit has changed the state.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ISIS-MIB::hwIsisCircStateChanges

description: The Adjacency State Change Notification is generated when the state
of an Adjacency on the Circuit changes from Up to Down or Down to
Up. For these purposes the states Up and Up/dormant are considered
to be Up, and any other state is considered to be Down. The occurance
of this event is counted by the isisCircAdjChanges counter.
The state of the adjacency
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjState

description: The number of times an adjacency state change has
occurred on this circuit.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisCircAdjChanges

description: The system ID and circuit ID of the neighboring
Intermediate System set from the source ID field
of the neighbor's IIH PDUs.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSysID

description: The Initialisation Failure Notification is
generated when an attempt to initialise with an adjacent system fails
as a result of either Version Skew or Area Mismatch. In the case of
Version Skew, the Adjacent system argument is not present. The
occurance of this event is counted by the isisCircInitFails counter.
The system ID and circuit ID of the neighboring
Intermediate System set from the source ID field
of the neighbor's IIH PDUs.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSysID

description: The number of times initialization of this circuit has
failed.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisCircInitFails

description: The Rejected Adjacency Notification is generated when an attempt
to create a new adjacency is rejected, because of a lack of resources. The occurance of this event is counted by the isisCircRejAdjs counter.

event.Summary: IS-IS adjacency rejected due to lack of resources

description: The system ID and circuit ID of the neighboring
Intermediate System set from the source ID field
of the neighbor's IIH PDUs.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisISAdjNeighSysID

description: The number of times an adjacency has been rejected on
this circuit.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisCircRejAdjs

description: The LAN L1 Designated Intermediate System Change Notification
is generated when the local system either elects itself or resigns as
being the LAN L1 Designated Intermediate System on this
circuit. The relative order of these events must be
preserved. The occurance of this event is counted by
the isisCircLANL1DesISChanges counter.

event.Summary: LAN L1 designated intermediate system changed

description: The number of times the LAN Level 1 Designated
Intermediate System has changed.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisCircLANL1DesISChanges

description: The LAN L2 Designated Intermediate System Change Notification
is generated when the local system either elects itself or resigns as
being the LAN L2 Designated Intermediate System on this
circuit. The relative order of these events must be
preserved. The occurance of this event is counted by
the isisCircLANL2DesISChanges counter.

event.Summary: LAN L2 designated intermediate system changed

description: The number of times the LAN Level 2 Designated
Intermediate System has changed.
variables.name: ISIS-EXPERIMENTAL-V3-MIB::isisCircLANL2DesISChanges
